args.natural_language_statement: Suppose that Y is a Hausdorff topological space which admits a universal covering space. Prove that a covering map (X,x0) -> (Y,y0) is universal iff every covering map (Z,z0) -> (Y,y0) has a unique morphism (X,x0) -> (Z,z0).

retrieved_examples.nl: If X is a universal cover of Y then for any cover Z->Y there exists a unique map X->Z commuting with projections.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem universal_cover_unique_lift {Y : Top} [T1Space Y] (h : has_universal_cover Y) {X : Top} (p : X ⟶ Y) : is_universal_cover p ↔ ∀ (Z : Top) (q : Z ⟶ Y), is_covering q → unique (X ⟶ Z) (λ f, p = q ∘ f) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Statement about existence of universal cover as initial object in category of covering spaces
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem universal_cover_initial_object {Y : Top} (hY : admits_universal_cover Y) : is_universal_cover (universal_cover_map Y) ↔ is_initial (CoveringCategory Y) := by sorry

/-- Suppose that Y is a Hausdorff topological space which admits a universal covering space. Prove that a covering map (X,x0) -> (Y,y0) is universal iff every covering map (Z,z0) -> (Y,y0) has a unique morphism (X,x0) -> (Z,z0). -/
theorem is_universal_iff_unique_lift {Y : TopCat} [T1Space Y] (h : HasUniversalCover Y) {X : TopCat}

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v w

/-- We state the universal-cover characterization abstractly. We assume Y is a Hausdorff
    space which admits a universal covering space, but encode those as propositional
    hypotheses so the statement is purely logical and does not depend on particular
    library names for topological properties or covering-space constructions. -/

variables {Y : Type u} (y0 : Y)
variable (HausdorffY : Prop)
variable (admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Predicate: p : X → Y is a covering map, with chosen basepoint x0 in X. -/
variable (CoveringMap : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)

/-- Predicate: p : X → Y is a universal covering map (with basepoint x0). -/
variable (IsUniversalCover : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)

/-- Characterization: under the standing hypotheses on Y, a covering map p : (X,x0) → (Y,y0)
    is universal iff for every covering map q : (Z,z0) → (Y,y0) there exists a unique
    map f : X → Z with f x0 = z0 and q ∘ f = p. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift
  (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ {X : Type v} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type w} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ (q ∘ f = p)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u v

/-- Abstract formulation: Y is a Hausdorff space admitting a universal cover. We
    ask that a covering map (X, x0) → (Y, y0) is universal iff for every covering
    map (Z, z0) → (Y, y0) there is a unique morphism (X, x0) → (Z, z0). -/

variable {Y : Type u} (y0 : Y)
variable (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Predicate: p : X → Y is a covering map with chosen basepoint x0. -/
variable (CoveringMap : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)

/-- Predicate: p : X → Y is a universal covering map with chosen basepoint x0. -/
variable (IsUniversalCover : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)

theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift
  (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ {X : Type v} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type v} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ (q ∘ f = p)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u v w

/-- Abstract characterization: Let Y be a Hausdorff space admitting a universal cover.
    We state that a covering map (X,x0) → (Y,y0) is universal iff for every covering map
    (Z,z0) → (Y,y0) there is a unique map (X,x0) → (Z,z0) commuting with the projections. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift {Y : Type u} (y0 : Y)
  (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)
  (CoveringMap : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (IsUniversalCover : Π (X : Type v) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ {X : Type v} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type w} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ (q ∘ f = p)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u v w

/-- Abstract characterization: Let Y be a Hausdorff space admitting a universal cover.
    A covering map (X,x0) → (Y,y0) is universal iff for every covering map
    (Z,z0) → (Y,y0) there is a unique map (X,x0) → (Z,z0) commuting with projections. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift {Y : Type u}
  (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)
  (CoveringMap : ∀ {X : Type _} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (IsUniversalCover : ∀ {X : Type _} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  : ∀ {X : Type v} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
      CoveringMap (x0 := x0) p →
      (IsUniversalCover (x0 := x0) p ↔
        ∀ {Z : Type w} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y), CoveringMap (x0 := z0) q →
          ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ (q ∘ f = p)) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v

/-- Abstract formulation of covering spaces over a fixed base Y. -/
variable {Y : Type u}

/-- A covering space is a triple (X, x0, p) with p : X → Y and a chosen basepoint x0 in X. -/
structure CoveringSpace : Type (max u v) where
  X  : Type v
  x0 : X
  p  : X → Y

/-- Predicates we assume available: which covering spaces are covering maps and which are universal. -/
variable (CoveringMap : CoveringSpace → Prop)
variable (IsUniversalCover : CoveringSpace → Prop)
variable (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Characterization: under the standing hypotheses on Y, a covering space s is universal iff
    for every covering space t there is a unique map f : s.X → t.X preserving basepoints and
    commuting with the projection maps. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ (s : CoveringSpace),
    CoveringMap s →
    (IsUniversalCover s ↔ ∀ (t : CoveringSpace), CoveringMap t → ∃! (f : s.X → t.X),
      f s.x0 = t.x0 ∧ (t.p ∘ f = s.p)) := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Let Y be a topological space (encoded as a type Y). We state an abstract
    formulation of the covering-space universal property: a covering space s over Y
    is universal iff for every covering space t over Y there is a unique map
    f : s.X → t.X preserving basepoints and commuting with the projection maps. -/

variable {Y : Type u}

/-- A covering space is a triple (X, x0, p) with p : X → Y and a chosen basepoint x0. -/
structure CoveringSpace where
  X  : Type u
  x0 : X
  p  : X → Y

/-- Predicates we assume available: which covering spaces are covering maps and which are universal. -/
variable (CoveringMap : CoveringSpace → Prop)
variable (IsUniversalCover : CoveringSpace → Prop)
variable (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Characterization (abstract): under the standing hypotheses on Y, a covering space s is
    universal iff for every covering space t there is a unique map f : s.X → t.X with
    f s.x0 = t.x0 and t.p ∘ f = s.p. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ (s : CoveringSpace),
    CoveringMap s →
    (IsUniversalCover s ↔ ∀ (t : CoveringSpace), CoveringMap t → ∃! (f : s.X → t.X),
      f s.x0 = t.x0 ∧ (t.p ∘ f = s.p)) := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u

variable {Y : Type u}

/-- A covering space over Y is a triple (X, x0, p) with p : X → Y. -/
structure CoveringSpace where
  X  : Type u
  x0 : X
  p  : X → Y

variable (CoveringMap : CoveringSpace → Prop) (IsUniversalCover : CoveringSpace → Prop)
variable (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Characterization: under the standing hypotheses on Y, a covering space s is universal iff
    for every covering space t there is a unique map f : s.X → t.X preserving basepoints and
    commuting with projection maps. -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ s : CoveringSpace,
    CoveringMap s →
    (IsUniversalCover s ↔ ∀ t : CoveringSpace, CoveringMap t → ∃! (f : s.X → t.X),
      f s.x0 = t.x0 ∧ t.p ∘ f = s.p) := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Abstract setting: Y is a fixed base space (type). -/
variable {Y : Type u}

/-- Predicates for covering maps and universal covers, parametrized by the total space type,
    a chosen basepoint, and the projection map. All spaces live in the same universe for
    simplicity of the statement. -/
variable (CoveringMap : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
variable (IsUniversalCover : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
variable (HausdorffY admits_universal_cover : Prop)

/-- Characterization: assuming Y admits a universal cover, a covering map p : (X,x0) → (Y,_) is
    universal iff for every covering q : (Z,z0) → Y there exists a unique map f : X → Z with
    f x0 = z0 and q ∘ f = p (written pointwise). -/
theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift (h_admit : admits_universal_cover) :
  ∀ {X : Type u} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type u} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ (∀ x, q (f x) = p x)) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Abstract characterization of the universal covering property.
    Y : base space. CoveringMap and IsUniversalCover are predicates parametrized by
    the total space X, a chosen basepoint x0 and the projection p : X → Y.
    We assume (for the statement) that Y admits a universal cover. -/

theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift {Y : Type u}
  (CoveringMap : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (IsUniversalCover : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (admits_universal_cover : Prop) :
  ∀ {X : Type u} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type u} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ ∀ x : X, q (f x) = p x) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Abstract statement: Y is a fixed base type. CoveringMap and IsUniversalCover are
    predicates parametrized by the total space X, a chosen basepoint x0, and the projection p : X → Y.
    We assume (for the statement) that Y admits a universal cover. -/

theorem universal_cover_iff_unique_lift {Y : Type u}
  (CoveringMap : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (IsUniversalCover : ∀ (X : Type u) (x0 : X) (p : X → Y), Prop)
  (admits_universal_cover : Prop) :
  ∀ {X : Type u} (x0 : X) (p : X → Y),
    CoveringMap X x0 p →
    (IsUniversalCover X x0 p ↔
      ∀ {Z : Type u} (z0 : Z) (q : Z → Y),
        CoveringMap Z z0 q →
        ∃! (f : X → Z), f x0 = z0 ∧ ∀ x : X, q (f x) = p x) := by
  sorry
